dialogue.raw_text: (pushing away from the palm outstretched little hands of the boys)
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: SUPERMAN VIEW ACROSS THE MEN TO THE STAGE FREDO
VIEW ON THE MEN SENATOR GEARY
PRIVATE BALCONY OF CORLEONE APARTMENT AT TROPICANA

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating Rocco and Neri on the balcony)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It was not an alias.  GODFATHER was a term of affection, used by his friends, one of respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me agree with that.  Many of my constituents are Italian and have been honored with that certain friendship by my close Italian friends.  Up to this point before I have to leave this hearing to join my own committee, let me say, that this hearing on the Mafia is in no way a slur on the Italians by the Senate; nor is it meant to be; nor will I allow it to be.  Italian Americans are the hardest working, most law abiding patriotic Americans of our country.  It is a shame and a pity that a few rotten apples give them a bad name.  We are here to weed those rotten apples out of the vast healthy barrel of Italian Americans, who are one of the backbones of our country. There is a pause for a while, while the New York Senator poses for the TV cameras and leaves the hearing so that he will not be associated with hearing the rough stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure we all agree with our esteemed colleague.  Now, Mr. Corleone, you have been advised as to your legal rights.  We have had testimony from a preceding witness who states you are head of the most powerful Mafia family in this country.  Are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This witness has testified that you are personally responsible for the murder of a New York Police Captain in the year 1947 and with him a man named Virgil Sollozzo.  Do you deny this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I deny his every charge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true that in the year 1950 you devised the murder of the heads of the Five Families in New York, to assume and consolidate your nefarious power?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is a complete falsehood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true that you own a controlling interest in three of the major hotels in Las Vegas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is not true.  I own some stock in some of the hotels, but only very small amounts.  I also own some American Telephone and IBM stock. Michael had checked this point with Hagen, before answering, and then once again after the answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is it necessary for your counsel to advise you on that question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senator, I've observed the head of General Motors before a Senate Committee, and his lawyer whispered in his ear.  That was not commented upon in the way you have just done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Corleone, do you have any hotel interests in the state of Arizona? Or any gambling interests in that state?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have interests or control over gambling and narcotics in the state of New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not. A pause.  Silence, as the Chairman whispers something to his assistant. Tom Hagen takes a paper out of his briefcase, and addresses the Chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senator, my client would like to read a statement for the record.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that's necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, my client has answered every question asked by this committee with the utmost cooperation and sincerity.  He has not taken that Fifth Amendment as it was his right to do, and which because of the extreme legal complexity of this hearing, counsel advised him to do. So, I think in all fairness this committee should hear his statement and put it in the record.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well. At this point Senator Rogers contemptuously walks out of the hearing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the hopes of clearing my family name, in the sincere desire to give my children their fair share of the American way of life without a blemish on their name and background I have appeared before this committee and given it all the cooperation in my power.  I consider my being called before this committee an act of prejudice to all Americans of Italian extraction. I consider it a great dishonor to me personally to have to deny that I am a criminal.  I wish to have the following noted for the record. That I served my country faithfully and honorably in World War II and was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross for actions in defense of my country.  That I have never been arrested or indicted for any crime whatsoever... that no proof linking me to any criminal conspiracy, whether it is called Mafia or Cosa Nostra or whatever other name you wish to give, has ever been made public.  Only one man has made charges against me, and that man is known to be a murderer, arsonist and rapist.  And yet this committee had used this person to besmirch my name.  My personal protest can only be made to the people of this country.  I can only thank God that in this country we have a legal system and courts of law to protect innocent people from wild accusation.  I thank God for our democratic due process of Law that shields me from the false charges made by this committee's witness.  I have not taken refuge behind the Fifth Amendment, though counsel advised me to do so.  I challenge this committee to produce any witness or evidence against me, and if they do not, I hope they will have the decency to clear my name with the same publicity with which they have now besmirched it.  I ask this without malice, in the interests of fair play. The television cameras have documented this moment, as Hagen hands the document over to the committee lawyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are all impressed.  The committee will now recess over the weekend. However, it will continue Monday morning, at eleven a.m.  At that time, this committee will then produce a witness directly linking Mr. Corleone to the charges we have made.  And then, Mr. Corleone may very well by liable for indictments of perjury.  However, this document will be made a matter of record. EXT. ARMY POST - DAY An army post somewhere in the East.  It is safely guarded. INT. HOUSE ON THE POST - DAY where Pentangeli is being held by his constant companions, the two FBI MEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten to one shot, you said.  Ten to one shot in my favor, and I lose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a good night's sleep.  We got a new suit, new shirt, new tie, and I'm going to shave you myself. Tomorrow we want you to look respectable for fifty million of your fellow Americans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My life won't be worth a nickel after tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a special home for you for the rest of your life.  Nobody gets near you.  You're not going any place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, some deal I made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You live like a king.  You'll be a hero.  You'll live better in here than most people on the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some deal. (pause) I just wish Mike had took the Fifth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you do it, Frankie?  After all these years, why'd you turn against him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't turn against nobody; he turned against me. EXT. THE BOATHOUSE ALCOVE - DAY A somewhat frightened Fredo Corleone sits in the easy chair overlooking the lake in this canopied section of the boathouse.  Rocco sits with him. INT. BOATHOUSE - DAY Michael is in the dark room with Hagen and Neri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did they get their hands on Pentangeli?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roth engineered it, Michael.  He made Pentangeli think you hit him. Deliberately letting him get off alive.  Then the New York detectives turned Frankie over to the FBI.  My informants say he was half dead and scared stiff -- talking out loud that you had turned on him and tried to kill him.  Anyway, they had him on possession, dealing in heroin, murder one and a lot more. There's no way we can get to him and you've opened yourself to five points of perjury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've got him airtight.  He's in a military base, twenty-four hour guards.  Trying to kill him is like trying to like the President -- it's impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does Fredo know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he doesn't know anything, and I believe him.  Roth played this one beautifully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.  I'm going to go outside and talk to Fredo. EXT. BOATHOUSE FOYER - DAY Fredo sits on the couch.  When Rocco sees Michael, he automatically takes his leave.  Michael sits in the chair opposite Fredo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a lot to say, Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was kept pretty much in the dark. I didn't know all that much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about now, is there anything you can help me out with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know they get Pentangeli, that's all I know. Fredo gets up, walks to the glass panel that separates the terrace from the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know it was a hit.  I swear to you I didn't know.  Johnny Ola contacted me in Beverly Hills -- said he wanted to talk.  He said you and Roth were in on some big deal, and there was a place for me in it if I could help them out. They said you were being tough on the negotiation, and if they had a little bit of help, they could close it fast and it would be good for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you believed that story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said there was something good in it for me...me on my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've always taken care of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taken care of me.  Mike, you're my kid brother, and you take care of my.  Did you ever think of that. Ever once?  Send Fredo off to do this, send Fredo to take care of that... take care of some little unimportant night club here, and there; pick somebody up at the airport.  Mike, I'm your older brother; I was stepped over!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the way Pop wanted it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't the way I wanted it!  I can handle things.  I'm not dumb Christ, not like everyone says. I'm smart; and I want respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing more you can tell me about this investigation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lawyer; Questadt, he belongs to Roth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're nothing to me now, Fredo; not a brother, not a friend, I don't want to know you, or what happens to you.  I don't want to see you at the hotels, or near my home.  When you visit our Mother, I want to know a day in advance, so I won't be there.  Do you understand? Michael turns, and starts to leave.  A frightened voice behind him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mikey? Michael doesn't stop, doesn't turn back.  He continues off through the veranda, and out the summer doors. Neri stops by him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want anything to happen to him while my Mother's alive. Michael leaves. EXT. ARMY POST - DAY Five cars brimming with Army guards and Agents are waiting to move Pentangeli.  There is one empty car. INT. GUARDED HOUSE - DAY The two FBI Agents are helping Pentangeli get dressed.  He's in brightly colored striped shorts and bare-chested.  The Agents help him with the shirt and tie.  One holds out the trousers but Pentangeli ignores it and looks at himself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready, Frankie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. The Agents open the door, and precede him, surveying the area.  They check the cars waiting, each with two Agents. They check the gate and note the military sentries.  Then they stand aside, and let Pentangeli come out.  They get close to his side, and it is obvious they will protect his life with their own. EXT. ARMY POST - DAY The Agents put him in the front seat of the empty car, and get in with him, one at each side.  Another Agent drives. Now, the first cars start out; the Sentries opening the gates, and letting the caravan pass. An Army supply truck comes very close to them, and the Agents next to Pentangeli become very tense.  Pentangeli grins.  Then the truck passes on, and they relax. INT. SENATE CAUCUS ROOM - DAY The room is crowded with TV journalists, cameras, etc.  We pick Pentangeli up, closely guarded, being led to witness chair. Pentangeli is seated, and made to take his oath.  FBI Agents are all around him. MED. VIEW Anyone given entrance to the caucus room is being frisked. The five Senators take their places. VIEW ON HAGEN waiting at his long table, very nervous.  He seems startled by the appearance of Pentangeli. VIEW ON PENTANGELI catching Hagen's eye.  It's as though he is pleading for some kind of understanding of the fact that he has become a traitor. VIEW ON HAGEN cold; then he turns away. VIEW ON THE ENTRANCE The bustle is settling down; then Michael Corleone enters, and with him is someone very peculiar and out of keeping for this setting.  A burly-chested imposing man of middle age. Very powerful-looking with frightening magnetic eyes.  His dress is odd: boots, rough tie, and shirt.  He could be the tenor out of a Sicilian opera.  He is clearly a country Don, direct from Sicily, and he dominates the room. VIEW ON PENTANGELI At first his view is blocked.  Then he sees Michael and is a bit shamefaced, but still defiant. PENTANGELI'S POV Michael returns his glances without emotion.  Then the VIEW ALTERS, revealing the Sicilian. VIEW ON PENTANGELI He is terror stricken; obviously he recognizes the man. VIEW ON HAGEN'S TABLE Michael and the Sicilian sit by Hagen, where they can stare directly at Pentangeli; he is frozen with fear. VIEW ON THE SENATOR Notices the tension in the room.  The Chairman commences:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have here a witness who will testify further on Michael Corleone's rule of the criminal empire that controls gambling in this country and perhaps in other countries.  This witness had no buffer between himself and Michael Corleone.  He can corroborate our charges on enough counts for this committee to consider a charge of perjury against Michael Corleone. (then he turns to Pentangeli) Your name please, for the record.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank Pentangeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you a member of the Corleone Family?  Were you under the Caporegime Peter Clemenza, under Vito Corleone, known as the Godfather? There is a long silence. VIEW ON PENTANGELI He seems unable to speak. VIEW ON THE SICILIAN gazing at him. VIEW ON PENTANGELI PENTANGELI I never knew no Godfather.  I got my own family. Senator Kane is stunned.  The two FBI men are alert, their eyes searching the room for what has intimidated their witness at the last moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Pentangeli, you are contradicting your confessions to our investigators; I ask you again, were you a member of a crime organization headed by Michael Corleone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I never heard of it.  I never heard of nothing like that.  I was in the olive oil business with his father a long time ago.  That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have your confession that you murdered on the orders of Michael Corleone.  Do you deny that confession and do you know what denying that confession will mean to you? The die is cast and like a good soldier, Pentangeli will go all the way now.  So he is brazen in his defiance of the Senator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The FBI guys promised me a deal. So I made up a lot of stuff about Michael Corleone.  Because then, that's what they wanted.  But it was all lies.  Everything.  They said Michael Corleone did this, Michael Corleone did that.  So I said, "Yeah, sure." He makes a big grin to show how he has made fools of everybody. VIEW ON THE FBI AGENTS glancing around the room; their eyes have settled on the Sicilian.  One of them scribbles a note on a piece of paper, and passes it to the Committee lawyer.  Then in turn it goes to Senator Kane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Hagen, would you kindly identify to this committee that gentleman sitting on your right hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.  His name is Vincenzo Pentangeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he related to the witness?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is, I believe, a brother. VIEW ON MICHAEL AND VINCENZO PENTANGELI They wait with no expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I would like you to take the stand. Vincenzo stares at him, uncomprehending.  There may just be a shadow of contempt.  He doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, the gentleman does not understand English.  He would not in any case, take the stand.  He came, at his own expense, to aid his brother in his trouble.  He is not under any jurisdiction of our government and his reputation in his own country is impeccable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The witness is excused; take him out. The guards and FBI Agents quickly remove Pentangeli, as everybody else in the room is required to sit still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senator Kane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This meeting is adjourned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This committee owes an apology!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The committee is adjourned until further notice. For the first time, in the midst of the confusion, Hagen smiles.  A bitter, contemptuous smile. VIEW ON MICHAEL The modest champion.  He rises and they take their leave. VIEW ON THE TWO FBI AGENTS They watch the Corleone party as they exit. INT. WASHINGTON HOTEL CORRIDOR - DAY The Corleone nurse is waiting, playing with the little girl MARY.  A distance away, the boy, Anthony, is standing by himself. INT. MICHAEL'S SUITE - WASHINGTON HOTEL - DAY The door to Michael's suite opens; Rocco leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Kay. Michael is sitting in an easy chair; he seems to have difficulty with his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, she's here. Michael rises, surprised.  Rocco steps back, and Kay enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had no idea...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to see you before you went back to Nevada.  Also, the children - Michael, they're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a minute.  They're outside with Esther.  I'm very happy for you... I suppose I knew that you're simply too smart for anyone ever to beat you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you sit down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to stay long; I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are a lot of things I want to talk to you about.  Things I've been thinking about -- changes I want to make.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's too late for changes, Michael.  I promised myself I wouldn't talk about it and I've gone and spoiled it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why too late?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Michael.  What really happened with Pentangeli?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His brother came to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't even know he had a brother. And where is he now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a plane back to Sicily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's all he had to do.  Just show his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all.  You see, in Sicily, in the old days... there was only one legitimate reason to kill a blood relative... only one.  IF he was a traitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would have killed his brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay, you've got it wrong.  That kind of thing's all over, I promised you.  This was between the two brothers.  Years ago Frankie had a young girlfriend; he called her his co-wife.  That was his joke, but he meant it.  He wouldn't divorce his wife... because she was a great cook.  He said he girlfriend made a spaghetti sauce once and it was so terrible he knew he could never marry her.  He set her up in a house in Jersey.  She had to be faithful... and she had to have kids. And she did, two, a boy and a girl. He had her checked out and watched so she couldn't cheat... but the girl couldn't stand that kind of life.  She begged him to let her go. He did.  He gave her money and made her give up the kids.  Then Frankie took them to Italy, and had them brought up by his brother Vincenzo. Where he knew they'd by safe. Kay begins to realize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he saw his brother in the hearing room, he knew what was at stake. (pause) I don't think Vincenzo would have done it.  He loves the kids, too. Omerta, Kay.  Honor, silence.  It had nothing to do with me.  It was between those brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bring the children up now; they want to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay, I told you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't let you leave!  Christ, do you think I'm going to let you leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't want to hear anything. There are things between men and women that will not change; things that have been the same for thousands of years.  You are my wife, and they are my children... and I love you and I will not let you leave, because you are MINE!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I do feel things for you, Michael; but now, I think it's pity. For the first time since I've known you, you seem so helpless.  You held me a prisoner once; will you try again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that's what it takes; then yes, I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this moment, I feel no love for you at all.  I never thought that could happen, but it has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go back tonight.  Bring the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't heard me. He moves to her; he does love her, and is tender with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I let you leave; how can I let you take my children away? Don't you know me?  You understand, it's an impossibility.  I would never let it happen; no, never, not if it took all my strength, all my cunning.  But in time, soon, you'll feel differently.  You see, you'll be happy that I stopped you.  I know you.  You'll forget about this; you'll forget about the baby we lost... and we'll go on, you and I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby I lost...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what it meant... and I'm prepared to make it up to you.  I will make changes; I can. (he clenches his fist tightly)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Senator from New York, very smooth, partly liberal, Tammany Hall)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: change; that I have learned, that I have the strength to change... And we have another child, a boy... and you'll forget the miscarriage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't a miscarriage.  And you with your cunning, couldn't you figure it out!  It was an abortion; an abortion, like our marriage is an abortion, something unholy and evil.  I don't want your son; I wouldn't bring another of your sons into this world.  An abortion, Michael... it was a son, and I had it killed, but this must all end! VIEW ON MICHAEL He had no hint, not in his wildest imagination could he have guessed that she would do such a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I know that now it's over; I knew it then, there would be no way you could ever forgive me, not with this Sicilian thing that goes back two thousand years. He is silent, though raging -- then, with all his passion, and his strength, he raises his arms, and strikes her across her neck, literally knocking her down to the floor, and hurting her badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't take my children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FADE IN: EXT. THE CORLEONE ESTATE AT TAHOE - FULL VIEW - DAY A collection of dark cars and black limousines are gathered to one side.  A few drivers wait quietly. And then, to the other extreme of the estate, is a small grouping of about twenty to thirty people, gathered near Michael's house. MED. CLOSE SHOT Connie Corleone, dressed simply and now showing her age without the carefully applied makeup which we have been used to, kneels down before the shrine of Santa Theresa, and puts down a bouquet of flowers, along with others that have been placed there.  We see that some have the simple silk ribbon with the word "Mama" hand-lettered upon it. Her two children stand close behind her; they had been raised by their Grandmother. Connie steps back, and moves through the small group of friends and relatives, into Michael's house. INT. MICHAEL'S HOUSE - CONNIE'S VIEW - DAY Fredo, kneeling by the coffin of his mother in a portion of the house that has been set aside for the wake.  Fredo concludes his prayer, wipes away the tears in his eyes and steps away from the coffin. He stops when he notices Neri, a little distance away, looking at him. VIEW ON NERI After a moment, he nods respectfully to Fredo, and steps forward, moving to the old woman's coffin.  Fredo moves to Hagen, who is there with his wife and children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom.  Where's Mike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's waiting for you to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I talk to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No chance.  I'm sorry, Freddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in the boathouse. INT. THE BOATHOUSE - MED. VIEW - DAY Michael sits quietly in the darkened room in one of the big sofas, dressed immaculately in suit and tie.  His two children, also dressed for the wake sit opposite him in the other oversized sofa, their shoes not touching the floor. We regard this tableau for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael?  It's Connie. She comes in, and sits down by his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to stay close to home now, is that alright? Michael nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Kay coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael, Fredo's in the house with Mama.  He asked for you, and Tom said he couldn't see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom is right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kids, why don't you go outside for a while? The children don't move; Connie realizes they will only listen to Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk to you, Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The children can stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hated you for so long, Michael; for so many years.  I think I did things to myself, to hurt myself, so that you would know -- and you would be hurt too.  But I understand you now; I think I do.  You were being strong for all of us, like Papa was.  And I forgive you, and want to be close to you now.  Can't you forgive Fredo; he's so sweet, and helpless without you. Slowly, Michael puts his hand on her hair, and touches her gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need me, Michael.  I want to be with you now. INT. MICHAEL'S HOUSE - DAY Friends, relatives; Francesca and her new husband, Gardner and their baby; Sandra Corleone; Teresa, her children; all the familiar faces of the family are present, quietly paying their respects to Mama. Some of the men can be seen in the kitchen, drinking wine, and talking in low voices. Fredo is there, broken-hearted over the loss of his Mother; like some lost child with no friends. MED. VIEW Michael enters the room, followed by Connie, who tends little Mary and Anthony. He approaches his brother, and then embraces.  Fredo breaks into tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, Mike.  Jesus Christ, Mike. VIEW ON MICHAEL embracing his brother, he glances up. VIEW ON NERI quiet, and deadly. EXT. THE TAHOE ESTATE - MED. VIEW - DAY Tom Hagen is talking in the distance to his wife, and one of his older sons; he kisses, and moves toward the boathouse. After crossing the lawn, he stops. VIEW ON SANDRA CORLEONE waiting there; obviously wanting to talk to him.  He continues, and she walks with him. MOVING VIEW ON THE TWO as they cross toward the boathouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to talk to him now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you tell him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, think of yourself for once. Don't let this opportunity slip through your fingers; don't do it. We're all trapped here, don't you see? He continues past her, without answering her.  Continues up to the boathouse.  He stops before he enters. HAGEN'S VIEW Fredo is sitting by the edge of the harbor with Michael's son Anthony; he is helping him with some fishing rig. INT. THE BOATHOUSE - VIEW ON MICHAEL - DAY looking through the window at his son and brother.  Neri sits in the room, dressed informally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, Tom.  Have you heard about our friend and partner, Mr. Hyman Roth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know he's in Israel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The High Court of Israel turned down his request to live as a 'returned Jew.' His passport's been invalidated except for return to the U.S.  He landed in Buenos Aires yesterday, offered a gift of one million dollars if they would give him citizenship.  They turned him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to try Panama...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They won't take him; not for a million, not for ten million.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His medical condition is reported as... "terminal."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been dying of the same heart attack for twenty years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That plane goes to Miami...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want it met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, it's impossible.  He'll be met by the Internal Revenue; the Customs Service, and half the FBI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like it when you use the word impossible; nothing is impossible...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike, it would be like trying to kill the President; there's no way we can get to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm surprised at you, Tom.  If there's anything certain; certain in life; if history has taught us anything, it's that you can kill... (he stops, then coldly)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  But perhaps your relucatance is because you've come to tell me that you're moving your family to Vegas, that you've been offered the Vice-Presidency of the Houstan Hotels there.  Or weren't you going to tell me at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you so hungry for traitors; do you want to find them everywhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are everywhere!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I turned Houstan down; I didn't see why I should tell you about an offer I turned down. (Michael begins to confuse him) Are you sure, Mikey?  Are you sure of what we're doing; what we'll gain; what does the family gain? Forget that, Mike; I already know the answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you do, Tom.  Then I can count on you to help me do the things I have to do.  If not, call Houstan, and become a Vice-President. Take your family and your mistress and move them to Las Vegas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you hurt me, Michael?  I've always been loyal to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.  Then you're staying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm staying. (he pauses...then, without being asked) Don't ever enjoy the cruel part of all this; Sonny never listened to me about that. (then he sits down, and opens his briefcase) Now, explain everything to me. EXT. THE HARBOR - DAY Fredo sits with Anthony, with a silly-looking fishing hat on his head, covered with lure and flies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, ole buddy, your Uncle Fredo's gonna teach you how to catch the big fish.  You know, when I was a kid, I did this amazing thing.  I went out on a fishing trip; me and my brothers and my Pop, and no one could catch a fish except me.  And this was my secret: (confidentially) Every time I would put the line down I would say a "Hail Mary" and every time I said a "Hail Mary" I would catch a fish.  Now, when it's sunset, we're gonna go out on the lake, and we're gonna try it. INT. GUARDED HOUSE - DAY The guards step aside as Tom Hagen enters the foyer of the house.  He shows a court order to them and they lead him up the stairs where he knocks on the door. INT. GUARDED HOUSE - DAY There is a KNOCK at the door.  The two guards show Hagen in and Hagen presents the court order to one of the FBI men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I prefer to see my client privately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room has a bug in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to go outside with him, in the open air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This room is not bugged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have guards outside and the electric fence.  There's no security reason for not letting us talk in the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. They pass out of the room. EXT. THE ARMY POST - DAY Hagen and Pentangeli outside, by the electric fence.  They cannot be overheard.  Pentangeli takes out some cigars and offers Hagen one.  Hagen takes it and Pentangeli lights both their cigars.  They puff on them contentedly.  They are comfortable together, almost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything is going to be okay, Frankie, don't worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did my brother go back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but don't worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's ten times tougher than me, my brother.  He's old-fashioned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  He wouldn't even go out to dinner.  Just wanted to go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my brother.  Nothing could get him away from that two mule town.  He coulda been big over here -- he could of had his own Family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom, what do I do now? The light is beginning to turn reddish as the sun falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frankie, you were always interested in politics, in history.  I remember you talking about Hitler back in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  We were young then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I still read a lot.  They bring me stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were around the old timers who dreamed up how the Families should be organized, how they based it on the old Roman Legions, and called them 'Regimes'... with the 'Capos' and 'Soldiers,' and it worked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it worked.  Those were great old days.  We was like the Roman Empire.  The Corleone family was like the Roman Empire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it was once. They both puff on their cigars.  Pentangeli lets himself be carried away by thoughts of old days of glory; Hagen thinks of other days too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Roman Empire... when a plot against the Emperor failed, the plotters were always given a chance to let their families keep their fortunes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but only the rich guys.  The little guys got knocked off.  If they got arrested and executed, all their estate went to the Emperor. If they just went home and killed themselves, up front, nothing happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that was a good break.  A nice deal. Pentangeli looks at Hagen; he understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They went home and sat in a hot bath and opened their veins, and bled to death.  Sometimes they gave a little party before they did it. Hagen throws away his cigar.  Pentangeli puffs on his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about anything, Frankie Five-Angels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Tom.  Thanks. They shake hands.  The FBI Agents come out to let Hagen out the gate.  Pentangeli is led back to the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your lawyer tell you he can get that 600 years reduced to 500? Pentangeli puffs on his cigar and reflects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You boys sure you can't get me a broad for tonight?  Give me a little party?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got some nice books. Pentangeli puffs on his cigar and gives the Agent a smile an old man gives a child.  He starts upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'll just take a hot bath. EXT. THE ARMY POST - DAY Hagen walks away; glances back.  Then gets into his waiting car and drives off. INT. THE BOATHOUSE - FULL VIEW - SUNSET Michael sits alone in the empty boathouse; in the shadows. INT. BOAT DOCK - SUNSET Neri stands by the dock area under the boathouse.  He pushes the button which lowers a boat by winch and tackle.  He wears a fishing cap. He steps into the boat, and pulls the small outboard, which glides the boat out into the harbor. MED. VIEW The boat pulls up alongside Fredo and Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we go; and remember the secret. He lifts Anthony into the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony. THEIR VIEW Connie, in houseclothes, is calling Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here; we're goin' fishing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't go; Michael wants to take him into Reno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah.  Okay, kid, you got to go to Reno with your Pop. He lifts the boy out of the boat, and puts him on the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll catch one for you, with the secret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry, Anthony. Neri stands the motor; and the boat with the two fisherman glides off. VIEW ON MICHAEL watching, from the dark window of the boathouse. INT. HIGH SECURITY HOUSE IN ARMY POST - NIGHT The FBI man knocks on the bathroom door in the house where they have kept Pentangeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frankie, open up.  You okay? No answer; he hammers on the door.  Using his elbow, and then a kick he breaks into the bathroom. HIS VIEW Pentangeli lying in a tub of water.  His stomach shows above it.  His wrists are cut and covered with blood.  The bath water has a purplish tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE TAHOE - MED. VIEW - SUNSET Fredo and Neri are fishing, each with lines out.  The VIEW MOVES CLOSER, and we can hear Fredo as he holds the pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... the Lord is with thee.  Blessed art thou amongst women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. LONG SHOT The boat on the shimmery lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us... We hear a quiet, echoing GUNSHOT; and then silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIAMI AIRPORT - NIGHT An exhausted Hyman Roth, ill-shaven, and in shirt-sleeves in taken into custody by a swarm of Customs, and FBI men.  They allow him to be photographed by press people; and television cameramen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Roth, we have to take you into custody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know. Some flashbulbs go off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you give us your reaction to the High Court of Israel's ruling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a retired investor on a pension, and I wished to live there as a Jew  in the twilight of my life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Roth is not a well man; he's tired of running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm an old man; at my age, it's too late to start worrying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true you are worth over three hundred million dollars, Mr. Roth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a retired investor, living on a pension... I came home to vote in the Presidential election, because they wouldn't give me an absentee ballot... The newsmen and photographers all laugh, as the FBI men move him away. CLOSE VIEW One of the newspapermen laughing we recognize to be Rocco Lampone. He moves closer to Roth, and shoves his revolver right against his head, and in a second, on camera, assassinates Roth.  People scream, as Rocco attempts to run down the airport corridor, limping as he does. FBI men easily pick him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. THE DRIVEWAY BY MICHAEL'S HOUSE - DAY A taxi cab waits by the house; its driver sleeping with a newspaper over his face. INT. MICHAEL'S HOUSE - DAY The cleaning woman, Esther, who had been with Kay for years, sits by the dining room table, weeping profusely.  Behind her, in the recreation room, we can see the tableau of Kay sitting on the couch, her little daughter Mary, between her knees, talking quietly about things we cannot hear.  Her son Anthony sits by himself, in another chair by the side of the room. MED. VIEW Connie comes into the house quickly, and moves toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay, you have to go. This prompts Esther to weep all the more.  Kay hugs her daughter, and kisses her many times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to hurry; he's coming. Kay puts her coat on; then stands, and reaches out for her son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, kiss Mama goodbye. He doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, you kiss your Mother goodbye! He rises, and walks to her.  Hugs her lifelessly. MED. CLOSE VIEW on Kay, kissing her boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, say goodbye; your Mama loves you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye. She restrains any tears; she has become too strong for tears. Kay starts to go; picks up Mary, kisses her, and starts to go. NEW VIEW She steps out the kitchen door; then she cannot help herself. Crouches down, outside, and calls to her son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, kiss me once. Then she looks up, and slowly rises. HER VIEW Michael has stepped into the dining room.  He seems older somehow; as though some sickness has taken more years away from him. VIEW ON KAY looks at him; instinctively, she takes a step back. VIEW ON MICHAEL slowly steps toward her. VIEW ON KAY Another step back; the door is still open. VIEW ON MICHAEL He moves closer to the door; stops, looks at her.  And then closes it obscuring any view of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. TAHOE ESTATE - DAY It is late fall -- most of the leaves have fallen on the grounds and there is quite a wind. MED. VIEW The water is whipped up by the wind, and the waves are high as they break against the pavilion.  We HEAR the MUSIC of time passing, of Michael, of the Godfather over these images. VIEW ON THE SWIMMING POOLS They have not been used in several months; they are drained and the bottoms are mossy and dark. VIEW ON THE MAIN GATE Leaves blowing past it; we don't see the button men; only a hint of someone in the gatehouse. VIEW ON THE HOUSES Some of the houses have had the summer awnings taken down, and put away.  Some of the windows have been boarded up. VIEW ON THE KENNELS There are still the guard dogs; some sleeping, some moving impatiently. As the MUSIC concludes its statement. MED. VIEW The peninsula of the private Corleone Harbor.  We see the figures of two people, seated at a table. MED. VIEW Michael sits at a table having a sparse lunch.  He is attended by his sister Connie, who seems to be the closest person now living on the estate with him.  We see from the way she pampers him with his lunch, that she has fallen into the role of a surrogate Mother-Wife.  He seems older than his years, as though his illness, diabetes, has taken its toll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry; I'm sure he got here on time.  The roads from the airport are so windy, it takes forever; I've driven them myself. She picks up some of the serving plates that he has left untouched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bring him out to you as soon as he comes. She moves back to the main house. MED. CLOSE VIEW ON MICHAEL He turns and looks at the rough water of the lake for a moment.  He slowly takes a sip of wine. EXT. A PLACE IN THE GARDEN - DAY There are a few chairs. MED. VIEW ON ANTHONY CORLEONE He is eighteen years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Dad. VIEW ON MICHAEL squinting up at his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony. He rises, and reaches up to his son, who is now taller than he; he embraces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've grown so tall... so tall in the last year.  You're much taller than me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was taller than you when I was fourteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down.  Your Aunt Connie and I waited for you to have some lunch, but now it's all dried out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's alright... alright. Good.  You'll graduate in another year, isn't that right?  You know... I never finished college.  I was a good student, but I never finished. Of course, there was a war then. Connie approaches them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me interrupt anything, this will just take a second.  Here. (she takes out a small needle, and begins to prepare it) Your father has to have his insulin shot.  Why don't you go to your room and put your things away, Anthony. She begins to give Michael the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry back; we'll talk.  We'll talk. Anthony goes on his way to the house with his things. Connie gives Michael the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever I see that lake so cold, I think of poor Fredo, drowned.  Lake Tahoe is very cold.  They say if a person drowns in it, that the body will remain mid-suspended -- perfectly preserved.  Some say it will remain forever. She finishes the shot, puts her things away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boy will be right back. She leaves. VIEW ON MICHAEL Alone in the garden. OUR VIEW begins to MOVE CLOSER to him.  We begin to HEAR MUSIC of the forties; happy music, swing music, as we move CLOSER to Michael.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. OLD CORLEONE HOUSE - MED. VIEW - NIGHT SONNY CORLEONE, his arm wrapped around a smiling red-faced Carlo Rizzi, pulls him into the Corleone dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, who knows my buddy Carlo Rizzi. Here... my brother Fredo, here's my Mom.  Mom, whatcha got cooking? And Carlo, this is my kid sister Connie.  Here, pull up a chair, Carol is sitting next to Connie. Oh, the droopy kid over there is Mike.  The college boy. An older, lanky man enters the room, his arms laden with presents.  This is TESSIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buon Natale, everybody.  Buon Natale... (he smiles at Tom Hagen) Hi, Tom, how's every little thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonderful, Sal. Now the study door opens, and DON CORLEONE enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is dinner ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two minutes. The Don happily regards his family; his sons and daughters and even some Grandchildren.  He raises a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good life, a long life to all my children, and friends.  To my grandchildren, and those that will be.  To our family. They all drink. They refill glasses; then Tessio proposes a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To our Godfather. They all drink. INT. THE DINING ROOM - MED. VIEW - NIGHT The family is happily at Christmas dinner.  Don Corleone seated at the head of the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you think of those Japs, eh? The nerve of those Japs, coming right here in our own backyard dropping bombs!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we could have expected it after the embargo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Expect it or not, those Japs don't have a right to drop bombs in our backyard.  Whose side you on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, do we have to talk about the war at the table?  On Christmas, much less. VIEW ON MICHAEL He has been listening to this discussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pop, I've decided I'm going to enlist. A quiet hush descends over the table, as though everyone knows the effect this will have on the old man.  Sonny tries to make light of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid, stay in college.  The girls are cuter, if you know what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pop had to pull a lot of strings to get you your deferment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never asked for it; I don't want it. VIEW ON DON CORLEONE Disturbed; but wise and prudent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son wants to talk about this, and so we'll talk, but not at the dinner table. He rises, and starts across the room toward his study.  Then he looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael. He disappears into his study.  Michael rises, glances around. People are generally tense over the situation.  Michael follows his father into the study. INT. DON CORLEONE'S OLD STUDY - NIGHT The Don closes the door behind his son, and then moves across the room.  He stops at the little bar there, and pours himself a brandy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what is this talk about joining the army?  Eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not talk; I'm doing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would risk your life for strangers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for strangers; for my country.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone not in your family, is a stranger.  Believe me, when trouble comes, your country won't take care of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how it was in the old world, Pop, but this is not Sicily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I know, Michael.  It's Christmas, your brothers and sister are all here -- we are happy. Let's not spoil this.  Go your own way, but when you are ready, come to me the way a son should.  I have hopes for you... CLOSE VIEW ON MICHAEL looking at his father with a mixture of great love, and also fear, and confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be a man like you.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HIGH SECURITY HOUSE IN ARMY POST
